section.name: About Cayenne
section.p: Cayenne is a powerful, full-featured OpenSource Object/Relational framework. Cayenne is written in Java and is intended for Java developers working with relational databases. Though its current release status is Alpha, Cayenne has been already successfully deployed in production environment on high volume sites.

Among other things Cayenne provides management of persistent Java objects mapped to relational databases, single method call queries and updates (including atomic updates of all modified objects), seamless integration of multiple databases into a single virtual data source. Cayenne is distributed with CayenneModeler - a complete GUI mapping tool that supports reverse-engineering of RDBMS schema, working with database mappings and generation of Java source code for the persistent objects.

Cayenne is an OpenSource project and as such encourages the community to participate in development, testing and writing documentation. This way we can produce a better product that will benefit its contributors as well as everybody else.

section.name: Cayenne News
section.p:
The main highlights of this release are:
added flattened relationships (direct many-to-many)
introduced type-safe queries using Java Class as a root
project structure update - linked files will have preset extensions. Old format can be upgraded via CayenneModeler and is still compatible with Cayenne runtime.
bug fixes, code cleanup and refactoring
Download the release from here.

During the playoffs, NHL.com services over a million page views per day. ObjectStyle and Central Park Software teamed up to create a new player/team statistics engine based on Cayenne with JSP frontend and Oracle backend. The project was successfully launched in October at the beginning of 2002-2003 season.

section.name: History
section.p: Idea of Cayenne was conceived back in April 2001 by a group of developers in Atlanta, USA. Current version is based on that original idea and is under active development since December 2001. Right now Cayenne has a growing international user and developer community.
